author: eirik watz

text: I'm content with being treated the same.  Like I've already clarified, I'm not here to make acquaintances.  I didn't counter your 'argument' because you didn't have an 'argument'.  Any semblance of a point you attempted to make was drowned out by your contradictory moralising.  You may not be here to take grammar lessons but I'm not here to be lectured by some imbecile so take your holier-than-thou nonsense and get outta here.
author: AgentEntropos

text: Then you will be treated with same pleasure. That's all I am saying. Also, the fact that you can't counter my argument with anything other than one spelling/grammar typo means you have nothing worth while to actually say. I am not here to take grammar lessons or to have perfect spelling for your sake. The best part of your comment is you read all of mine, after stating people won't read past the first five sentences. You talk straight out of your ass, and it just screams hypocrite.
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: If you want to be taken seriously then you should use correct spelling, punctuation and grammar.  For example, needlessly capitalising the word grammar makes you look like a moron and most people won't read past the first sentence.  This is elementary level stuff.  I couldn't give a single fuck on what way people like to be addressed on YouTube.  I'm not here to make acquaintances.  If people can't grasp by all measures a fairly obvious point then I will treat them with the disdain they deserve.
author: AgentEntropos

text: Lol. What exactly does Grammar have to do with anything at hand? Seems like you should practice what you preach - "If you've nothing to say, don't say anything at all". Anyways have fun being Mr. know-it-all. By the way, just for future reference, most people don't like being spoken to in the arrogant self righteous manner that you do. It's fine to correct someone or impart wisdom upon another, but the manner in which you do it is the most important. Just remember that.
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: That's rich coming from someone who doesn't know how to use correct grammar.
author: AgentEntropos

text: I understand this happened 4 years ago now, but reading through these comments made me feel sorry for you. I just want to say I hope you've learned how to respect others more over the internet. If you're going to criticize and belittle people simply for using "your" instead of "you're," or stating that games and movies aren't as accurately relatable in their opinion, then you must be leading a sad life. No one deserves to be so belittled simply for one grammatical error. I suggest you gain a better sense of maturity, and correct people's mistakes with a sense of respect and kindness. Otherwise your social reputation will continue to go downhill, and you'll leave the impression that you must lead a very sad life.
author: Zipherys

text: That's quite a high horse your sitting on there.

author: Long John Silver

text: Haven't I already responded to a similar, inane comment?  Very astute observation there.  Next you'll be telling me GTA: Vice City wasn't inspired by Scarface.  It doesn't matter where the influence comes from.  In fact, it's often better if its based on outside mediums.  In this case it was direct plagiarism as the design was exactly the same (which is understandable given the iconic design of the Terminator).  Now go back to school and don't darken my doorway again.
author: AgentEntropos

author: Dtailz

text:
For me, the Suicide Mission sequence is the best final sequence in video game history, and I'm not one to say that kind of thing. It felt so impacting, so raw, yet so elegant and decisive. Every choice had you wondering, and every cutscene had you on end. ME2 is not my favourite game (I would put it in my top 20, but not in the top 10), because it had quite a bunch of plotholes down the way, but the Suicide Mission was wonderful.

Both the ME's are awesome. Let's hope 3 is even better.

author: Link8150

text: @animefanatic777 If you have a sufficient PC, it's quite regularly below 10$ on steam. Just wait for another EA week. I have not played Uncharted, but Mass Effect 2 is the most epic, dramatic gaming experience I have ever witnessed. It's not the "best game ever" by several points, but the tension and atmosphere it delivers are astounding. I connect many of my most emotional experiences in a game with Mass Effect 2, especially the suicide mission.
author: Joernboy

text: @Joernboy 'The best movie I have ever played...'Line is what I use when I explain the Uncharted series (Specifically the second one!) author: krits

text: @SupraDarky DA2 is well polished and has high presentation values much like Mass Effect.  It will keep you entertained until the end, but there are some serious flaws to it.  Re-used environments and enemies are a big one, along with a fumbled final chapter.  I do believe, however, that EA is only partially responsible for the mistakes in the final product.  A good storyline should have been written before the game was even started, so EA's rushing shouldn't be the cause to that blunder.
